recipe_name: Stilton bread with pear and port chutney
author: Lesley Waters
method: Preheat the oven to 180C/350F/Gas 4. For the bread, place all of the ingredients into a large bowl and beat together until combined.  Turn the mixture out onto a floured surface and knead for 1-2 minutes until it forms a dough.  Cut the dough into wedges, brush each wedge with a little olive oil and place onto a baking sheet. Transfer to the oven to bake for 15 minutes, or until risen and golden-brown on top.  Meanwhile, for the chutney, place the sugar, port and pear into a small saucepan and cook over a high heat for 6-7 minutes, or until the liquid has reduced by half. To serve, place the bread onto a plate with the chutney in a small bowl alongside.
ingredients: 200g/7oz self-raising flour,  1 tsp baking powder,  50g/1¾oz Greek yoghurt,  100g/3½oz Stilton, crumbled,  2 free-range eggs, beaten,  pinch salt,  olive oil, for brushing,  50g/1¾oz soft brown sugar,  500ml/17fl oz port,  1 pear, peeled, cored, finely chopped
